captions.text:
- You promised we
weren't going to be late!

- [Voiceover] Blow drying
my hair, I can't hear you.
- I'm gonna be in the car.

You gonna just text or
can you tell me where...

- I'm texting them that
we're gonna be late,

because you seem to think
that's a really big deal.

- Look who's here!
- Thanks for having us!
I told you to get in the shower by three!
- Why do you always have to touch people
- What the fuck are you talking about!
- Tell me you are not on the phone

(muffled) I just don't think
you need to share everything.

Are you seriously not even
going to try to talk to me?
- No, I am, of course I am.

I bought a (mumbles) and
you didn't say anything!
- Oh my god, are you crying?

- I'm sorry, OK, I take
it back, I'm sorry.
- When I dance with someone you freak out.
- You put your penis in her butt,

- She did that, I was
standing, I was a post,

I was standing there,
I wasn't even moving.

comments.author: AyoElla anvenue

comments.text:
In any relationship, couples will have their share of arguments and fights. 
That's reality and the truth. But yeah, I was watching this video, and I 
was thinking, I have rarely been late when it comes to dressing up and 
putting on makeup. My boyfriends didn't have to wait for me like the guy in 
this video when it came to me dressing up and putting on makeup. Like the 
gal in this video, I do drive a Honda, and I do like it when guys can show 
their soft side and cry. That's endearing - when a guy can cry and show 
vulnerability. I do agree with the gal when she said that sometimes some 
guys don't apologize enough or make their girlfriends feel appreciated or 
feel sexy or attractive. I feel that guys need to give some special 
compliments - at least a medium amount - to make their partners and 
girlfriends feel desired, attractive, sexy, loved, appreciated, good, 
amazing, etc.

To not give compliments to your girlfriend, partner, etc. is like not 
putting any fuel, water, sun to make the relationship stay strong, grow 
healthy, or stay alive. To fail to give compliments is like letting plants 
die, neglecting maintaining a car, etc. To fail to give compliments is like 
letting a relationship die. All relationships need SOME maintenance aka 
warmth, love, affection, compliments, making partner feel very special, 
etc., or they will fall apart and die. To not take good care of a 
girlfriend, partner, etc. is like not taking good care of a car, plant, 
pet, etc. It's letting something die or fall apart. Also, when you are a in 
relationship with someone, you need to tell that person what makes that 
person more special than others. Why be in a relationship with someone if 
you can't say, express, communicate, articulate, or share often to that 
person what makes them stand out and what makes them MORE special than 
other people? 

Regarding arguments - I will never understand why some couples argue over 
what restaurant to go to each week, what movies to watch, what concert to 
attend, etc. I feel if a couple loves each other and respects each other - 
then they will care about making each other happy, and learn to be fair, be 
more selfless, and compromise. For me, when I was in relationships - I 
would have my then boyfriends choose what restaurant they wanted to visit, 
what movie they wanted to go for one week, & THEN the next week was my 
choice of restaurant and movie to go to. Each month or every other month - 
I would go to a concert or event the boyfriend liked or wanted to attend, 
THEN the next month, etc., the boyfriend would go to a concert or event I 
wanted to attend. I've dated some of the most picky and finicky eaters - 
and we made things fair by taking turns on what restaurants and foods we 
ate. We took turns each week - and we were able to try new foods, new 
events, new movies, new places this way. It's about being thoughtful, 
trying new things and adventures TOGETHER, being sweet, selfless, 
considerate, loving, respectful of each other and caring about making each 
other happy.

A happy partner - happy boyfriend and happy girlfriend - equals happy life. 
Why fight over movies, restaurants, events, concerts, activities, food, 
etc. when you CAN take turns each week and be fair, compromise, and be 
considerate and respectful of each other? What matters the most is spending 
and sharing time with that person. So, taking turns, sharing, and 
compromising AND alternating choices and picks from you and your partner 
EACH week when it comes to your partner, girlfriend, boyfriend in the 
activities and things you do with each other IS the best policy. JMO. ﻿
